criteria: Ability to Locate and Identify Resources
descriptions: Student is unable to locate or identify any resources for first aid information and training.
Student can locate one resource but struggles to identify its purpose or relevance.
Student can locate a few resources but demonstrates difficulty in understanding their content or application.
Student can locate several resources and identify their basic purpose, but lacks depth in understanding their application.
Student can locate and identify a variety of resources, demonstrating a good understanding of their content and application.
Student skillfully locates and identifies a comprehensive range of resources, demonstrating a deep understanding of their content, specific applications, and limitations.
Student does not attempt to assess the validity of any resources.
Student attempts to assess validity but uses irrelevant or inappropriate criteria.
Student uses limited criteria to assess validity, with superficial justification.
Student uses some relevant criteria to assess validity, providing a basic justification for their assessment.
Student uses relevant criteria to assess validity, providing a clear and logical justification for their assessment.
Student thoroughly assesses the validity of resources using comprehensive, relevant criteria, providing insightful and well-supported justifications, and identifying potential biases or limitations.
Student uses only one type of resource, such as only internet resources.
Student uses only 2 types of resources, such as school and community, but no internet.
Student uses some resources found in school, community and internet.
Student uses different resources found in school, community and internet.
Student uses a diverse and expansive array of resources from school, community, and the internet, demonstrating a comprehensive approach to information gathering.
